definition: to adapt to sb's taste/to fit sb's fancy
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: You have to be able to capture the interest of your readers and hold it from the beginning of your article to the end.
sentences.chinese: 你要能够获悉读者的兴趣，并投其所好贯穿文章始末。

sentences.english: This requires that you carefully remember, psychographic.
sentences.chinese: 这就需要你用心记忆，投其所好。

sentences.english: Many executives surround themselves with people who think like they do.
sentences.chinese: 很多总裁身边的人都只是投其所好。

sentences.english: This county Wang Ye seems to be good at to throw it like.
sentences.chinese: 哦？这位郡王爷似乎很会投其所好。

definition: favor/liking/love/jubilation/joy
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: to cater to/to pander to
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to try to please
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to refuse nobody (idiom)/all comers welcome
